_comment: Example output for eval_006: James Okafor — PhD Epidemiology, AI for public health. QUALIFIED.
application_domain: Public health surveillance and pandemic preparedness

strengths.description: Strong academic record: 6 peer-reviewed publications (3 first-authored), 89 citations, 11 peer reviews — exceeds all Pathway A thresholds
Application domain is public health surveillance — Tier 1 national priority independent of AI methods used
strengths.evidence_reference: CDC guidance document publicly referencing the model

strengths.description: Real-world government adoption: model deployed by 12 state health departments, referenced in official CDC guidance
strengths.evidence_reference: CDC guidance document (objective, score 3) + state adoption letters (objective, score 3)

gaps.required_state: At least 2 independent reference letters from senior researchers or government officials
gaps.how_to_address: Secure letters from CDC supervisor and one academic collaborator. Ideally include one from a state health official who adopted the model.

evidence_inventory.claim: ML model for outbreak detection adopted by state health departments
objective_evidence: CDC guidance document citing the model (publicly available)
evidence_inventory.notes: Exceptionally strong objective evidence. Government adoption at this scale is rare and highly persuasive.

evidence_inventory.claim: Peer-reviewed research record in public health surveillance
evidence_inventory.notes: Exceeds all Pathway A thresholds. First-authored papers carry stronger weight.

recommended_pillars_preview.title: Real-Time ML-Based Disease Outbreak Detection
recommended_pillars_preview.rationale: The wastewater surveillance model is the centerpiece contribution — concrete, government-adopted, and directly tied to pandemic preparedness.

recommended_pillars_preview.title: Scalable Public Health Surveillance Infrastructure for State Agencies
recommended_pillars_preview.rationale: The 12-state adoption story frames this as national infrastructure, not a one-off research project.

recommended_pillars_preview.title: Open-Access Epidemiological Research for Under-Resourced Health Systems
recommended_pillars_preview.rationale: If any publications are open-access or datasets are shared, this third pillar ties research dissemination to equity and national capacity-building.

field_alignment_notes: User described field as 'AI for public health surveillance.' AI is the method; public health surveillance is the domain. Public health and pandemic preparedness is an explicit NSTC Tier 1 priority. Field alignment is strong regardless of methodology used.
evaluator_notes: This is a strong case. The combination of a PhD from a top program, above-threshold publication and citation record, and — crucially — real government adoption with public objective evidence is exactly what NIW reviewers want to see. The only gap is absence of reference letters, which is standard to address. Recommend proceeding to NIW_Endeavor with the three pillar previews above.
